sources.title: Mr. Wise Guy (1942)
sources.description: The gang is sent to the Wilton Reform School after they are unjustly convicted of stealing a truck. Bill Collins, brother of co-leader Danny, becomes involved in a killing and, while also innocent, is convicted and sentenced to death. Through a series of events, Muggs, Glimpy, Danny and the rest of the gang, learn that Knobby, a henchman of Luke Manning, knows something about the murder. sources.title: Mr. Wise Guy
sources.description: The number eight in the East SIde Kids series. The kids are sent to reform school after being falsely accused of stealing a truck.

sources.title: Mr. Wise Guy (1942) THE EAST SIDE KIDS
sources.description:
Stars: Leo Gorcey, Bobby Jordan, Huntz Hall
Director: William Nigh

The gang is sent to the Wilton Reform School after they are unjustly convicted of stealing a truck.

metadata.Plot: Mr. Wise Guy (the eighth in the East Side Kids series) finds the gang sent to the Wilton Reform School after they are unjustly convicted of stealing a truck. Bill Collins (Douglas Fowley), brother of co-leader Danny (Bobby Jordan), becomes involved in a killing and, while also innocent, is convicted and sentenced to death. Through a series of events, Muggs (Leo Gorcey), Glimpy (Huntz Hall), Danny and the rest of the gang, learn that Knobby (Billy Gilbert), a henchman of Luke Manning (Guinn Williams), knows something about the murder.
metadata.Writer: Martin Mooney, Sam Robins, Harvey Gates
metadata.Actors: Leo Gorcey, Bobby Jordan, Huntz Hall
